question_text: Which Stephen Sondheim musical features the song "Being Alive"?
explanation: "Being Alive" is the Act II finale song for Robert in Company.

question_text: In Company, who sings "The Ladies Who Lunch"?
explanation: Joanne sings "The Ladies Who Lunch" in Company.

question_text: In Company, "Getting Married Today" is sung by which character?
explanation: Amy leads "Getting Married Today" (with Paul and others).

question_text: In Company, "Barcelona" is a duet between Robert and which girlfriend?
explanation: "Barcelona" is sung by Robert and April.

question_text: In Company, the dance piece "Tick-Tock" is associated with which character?
explanation: "Tick-Tock" is an instrumental dance associated with Kathy in Company.

question_text: In Company, who sings "Another Hundred People"?
explanation: Marta sings "Another Hundred People" in Company.

question_text: For which musical did Sondheim write the lyrics but not the music?
option_d: Sunday in the Park with George
explanation: Sondheim wrote lyrics for West Side Story, with music by Leonard Bernstein.

question_text: Who composed the music for Gypsy (lyrics by Sondheim)?
explanation: Gypsy has music by Jule Styne and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim.

question_text: Do I Hear a Waltz? features music by which composer?
explanation: Do I Hear a Waltz? is scored by Richard Rodgers, with lyrics by Sondheim.

question_text: West Side Story: who wrote the music (with Sondheim as lyricist)?
explanation: West Side Story's music is by Leonard Bernstein.

question_text: The opening number "Comedy Tonight" comes from which musical?
option_a: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: "Comedy Tonight" opens A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.

question_text: In A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, what is the name of the scheming slave protagonist?
explanation: Pseudolus is the central scheming slave in Forum.

question_text: Forum draws heavily on plays by which Roman playwright?
explanation: Forum is based on farces by Plautus.

question_text: Anyone Can Whistle has a book by whom?
explanation: Anyone Can Whistle has music and lyrics by Sondheim, with a book by Arthur Laurents.

question_text: In Anyone Can Whistle  what is the name of the town's corrupt mayoress?
explanation: The corrupt mayoress in Anyone Can Whistle is Cora Hoover Hooper.

question_text: Which Sondheim musical is set in Sweden around 1900?
explanation: A Little Night Music is set in Sweden around the turn of the 20th century.

question_text: "Send in the Clowns" is sung by which character in A Little Night Music?
explanation: Desiree Armfeldt sings "Send in the Clowns".

question_text: A Little Night Music is based on which Ingmar Bergman film?
accepted_answers: Smiles of a Summer Night|Smiles of Summer Night
explanation: A Little Night Music is based on Bergman's film Smiles of a Summer Night.

question_text: Which number closes Act I of A Little Night Music?
explanation: Act I ends with "A Weekend in the Country".

question_text: In A Little Night Music, which character sings the comic show-stopper "The Miller's Son"?
explanation: Petra sings "The Miller's Son".

question_text: Which Sondheim musical centres on a reunion of former showgirls in a decaying theatre?
explanation: Follies takes place at a reunion in a crumbling Broadway theatre.

question_text: In Follies, "I'm Still Here" is sung by which character?
explanation: Carlotta Campion sings "I'm Still Here".

question_text: In Follies, "Losing My Mind" is sung by which character?
explanation: Sally sings "Losing My Mind".

question_text: In Follies, "The Road You Didn't Take" is sung by which character?
explanation: Ben sings "The Road You Didn't Take".

question_text: In Follies, which character sings "Broadway Baby"?
explanation: "Broadway Baby" is sung by Hattie Walker in Follies.

question_text: Merrily We Roll Along tells its story in what order?
explanation: Merrily We Roll Along runs backwards through time.

question_text: In Merrily We Roll Along, which main character is the composer?
explanation: Franklin Shepard is the composer.

question_text: In Merrily We Roll Along, Mary Flynn becomes which of the following?
explanation: Mary ends up as a critic/journalist.

question_text: "Old Friends" appears in which Sondheim musical?
explanation: "Old Friends" is a key song in Merrily We Roll Along.

question_text: What is the full name of Frank Shepard's lyricist friend in Merrily We Roll Along?
explanation: Frank's closest collaborator is Charley Kringas.

question_text: Which Into the Woods song includes the warning "Children will listen"?
explanation: The lyric appears in "Children Will Listen".

question_text: Into the Woods weaves together Cinderella, Jack, Rapunzel and which other fairy tale?
explanation: Into the Woods includes Little Red Riding Hood.

question_text: "Giants in the Sky" is sung by which character?
explanation: Jack sings "Giants in the Sky".

question_text: Which major character in Into the Woods has no given personal name in the script?
explanation: She is named only as "the Baker's Wife".

question_text: Into the Woods: name ONE of the four items the Witch demands to lift the curse.
accepted_answers: cow as white as milk|white cow|cape as red as blood|red cape|slipper as pure as gold|gold slipper|hair as yellow as corn|yellow hair
explanation: The Witch demands four items: cow, red cape, golden slipper, and yellow hair.

question_text: In Into the Woods, who sings "On the Steps of the Palace"?
explanation: Cinderella sings "On the Steps of the Palace".

question_text: In Into the Woods, who sings the duet "Agony"?
option_d: The Narrator and the Mysterious Man
explanation: The two Princes sing "Agony".

question_text: Which Sondheim musical won the 1985 Pulitzer Prize for Drama?
option_a: Sunday in the Park with George
explanation: Sunday in the Park with George won the 1985 Pulitzer Prize for Drama.

question_text: Sunday in the Park with George was inspired by which painting?
option_a: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
explanation: The musical draws from Seurat's La Grande Jatte painting.

question_text: Who painted A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte?
explanation: The painting is by Georges Seurat.

question_text: In Sunday in the Park with George, what is the name of George's lover and model?
explanation: Dot is George's lover and model in Act I.

question_text: "Finishing the Hat" is sung by which character?
explanation: George sings "Finishing the Hat".

question_text: In Act II of Sunday in the Park with George, the contemporary artist shares Seurat's name. What is it?
explanation: The modern artist is also named George.

question_text: "Move On" appears in which Sondheim musical?
option_a: Sunday in the Park with George
explanation: "Move On" is from Sunday in the Park with George.

question_text: Which museum holds Seurat's painting A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte?
accepted_answers: Art Institute of Chicago|The Art Institute of Chicago|AIC
explanation: The painting is in the Art Institute of Chicago's collection.

question_text: Which Sondheim musical is set in 19th-century Japan and begins in 1853 with American ships?
explanation: Pacific Overtures starts with Commodore Perry's arrival in 1853.

question_text: Pacific Overtures has a book by which collaborator?
explanation: Pacific Overtures has a book by John Weidman.

question_text: In Pacific Overtures, which American commodore appears as a character?
explanation: Commodore Matthew Perry appears in the story.

question_text: Which song opens Pacific Overtures by praising isolation in Japan?
option_a: The Advantages of Floating in the Middle of the Sea
explanation: The opening number is "The Advantages of Floating in the Middle of the Sea".

question_text: Which Sondheim-written film song won the Oscar for Best Original Song and is often listed as 'Sooner or Later (I Always Get My Man)'?
answer_text: Sooner or Later (I Always Get My Man)
accepted_answers: Sooner or Later|Sooner or Later (I Always Get My Man)|I Always Get My Man
explanation: Sondheim won the Academy Award for "Sooner or Later (I Always Get My Man)" from Dick Tracy.

question_text: The song 'Sooner or Later (I Always Get My Man)' was written for which film?
explanation: The song appears in the film Dick Tracy.

question_text: In Sweeney Todd, what was Sweeney Todd's original name?
explanation: Sweeney Todd's true name is Benjamin Barker.

question_text: Sweeney Todd's barber shop is on which street?
explanation: The show is subtitled The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

question_text: In Sweeney Todd  what is the name of the young sailor who falls in love with Johanna?
explanation: Anthony Hope is the sailor who falls for Johanna.

question_text: The lyric "No one's gonna harm you, not while I'm around" is from which Sweeney Todd song?
explanation: That line is from "Not While I'm Around".

question_text: In Sweeney Todd, "The Worst Pies in London" is sung by which character?
explanation: Mrs Lovett sings "The Worst Pies in London".

question_text: In Sweeney Todd, what is Sweeney Todd's daughter's name?
explanation: Johanna is Todd's daughter.

question_text: What is the title of the duet in Sweeney Todd where Todd and Mrs Lovett joke about turning people into pie fillings?
explanation: The comic duet is "A Little Priest".

question_text: Assassins includes which man who assassinated Abraham Lincoln?
explanation: John Wilkes Booth killed Abraham Lincoln.

question_text: What is the opening number of Assassins?
explanation: Assassins opens with "Everybody's Got the Right".

question_text: "Unworthy of Your Love" is sung by which pair in Assassins?
option_a: John Hinckley Jr and Lynette 'Squeaky' Fromme
option_b: Lee Harvey Oswald and Sara Jane Moore
option_d: John Wilkes Booth and Giuseppe Zangara
explanation: It's a duet for John Hinckley Jr and Lynette "Squeaky" Fromme.

question_text: "The Gun Song" appears in which Sondheim musical?
explanation: "The Gun Song" is from Assassins.

question_text: Passion is set primarily in which country?
explanation: Passion is set in Italy.

question_text: Passion is adapted from which film title (Ettore Scola)?
explanation: Passion adapts the film Passione d'Amore.

question_text: In Passion, what is the name of the sickly woman who becomes obsessed with Giorgio?
explanation: Fosca becomes obsessed with Giorgio.

question_text: In Road Show, the two brothers at the centre of the story share which surname?
explanation: Road Show centres on Addison and Wilson Mizner.

question_text: Road Show was previously developed under which earlier title?
explanation: Road Show developed from an earlier version titled Bounce.

question_text: The Frogs is (loosely) based on a comedy by which ancient Greek playwright?
explanation: The Frogs draws from Aristophanes' play.

question_text: In The Frogs, which god travels to the underworld to bring back a playwright?
explanation: Dionysus travels to the underworld in The Frogs.

question_text: In The Frogs, what is the name of Dionysus's slave companion?
explanation: Xanthias accompanies Dionysus.

question_text: AUDIO 01: Identify the song title (clip: Not a Day Goes By).
explanation: This clip is from "Not a Day Goes By" (Merrily We Roll Along).

question_text: AUDIO 02: Which musical is this song from? (clip: Giants in the Sky).
option_c: Sunday in the Park with George
explanation: This clip is from Into the Woods.

question_text: AUDIO 03: Identify the song title (clip: Sunday).
explanation: This clip is from "Sunday" (Sunday in the Park with George).

question_text: AUDIO 04: Which musical is this song from? (clip: Everybody's Got the Right).
explanation: This clip is from Assassins.

question_text: AUDIO 05: Identify the song title (clip: Could I Leave You?).
explanation: This clip is from "Could I Leave You?" (Follies).

question_text: AUDIO 06: Which musical is this song from? (clip: The Glamorous Life).
option_d: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: This clip is from A Little Night Music.

question_text: AUDIO 07: Identify the song title (clip: Epiphany).
explanation: This clip is from "Epiphany" (Sweeney Todd).

question_text: AUDIO 08: Which musical is this song from? (clip: A Little Priest).
explanation: This clip is from Sweeney Todd.

question_text: AUDIO 09: Identify the song title (clip: There Is No Other Way).
option_d: The Advantages of Floating in the Middle of the Sea
explanation: This clip is from "There Is No Other Way" (Pacific Overtures).

question_text: AUDIO 10: Identify the song title (clip: You Could Drive a Person Crazy).
option_a: You Could Drive a Person Crazy
explanation: This clip is from "You Could Drive a Person Crazy" (Company).

question_text: AUDIO 11: Which musical is this song from? (clip: Everybody Says Don't).
option_d: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: This clip is from Anyone Can Whistle.

question_text: AUDIO 12: Identify the song title (clip: The Ballad of Czolgosz).
explanation: This clip is from "The Ballad of Czolgosz" (Assassins).

question_text: AUDIO 13: Which musical is this song from? (clip: Take Me to the World).
explanation: This clip is from Evening Primrose (Sondheim TV musical).

question_text: AUDIO 14: Identify the song title (clip: Later).
explanation: This clip is from "Later" (A Little Night Music).

question_text: AUDIO 15: Write the song title (clip: Colour and Light).
accepted_answers: Colour and Light|Color and Light|Colour & Light|Color & Light
explanation: This clip is from "Colour and Light" (Sunday in the Park with George).

question_text: AUDIO 16: Identify the song title (clip: Good Thing Going).
explanation: This clip is from "Good Thing Going" (Merrily We Roll Along).

question_text: AUDIO 17: Identify the song title (clip: Franklin Shepard Inc.).
explanation: This clip is from "Franklin Shepard, Inc." (Merrily We Roll Along).

question_text: AUDIO 18: Which musical is this song from? (clip: No One Has Ever Loved Me).
explanation: This clip is from Passion.

question_text: AUDIO 19: Name the musical (clip: Someone in a Tree).
explanation: This clip is 'Someone in a Tree' from Pacific Overtures.

question_text: AUDIO 20: Which musical is this song from? (clip: Everything's Coming Up Roses).
explanation: This clip is from Gypsy (Sondheim wrote the lyrics).

question_text: PICTURE 01: Which show is this poster / key art for? (Assassins)
explanation: This image is associated with Assassins.

question_text: PICTURE 02: Which show is this poster / key art for? (Sunday in the Park with George)
option_a: Sunday in the Park with George
option_d: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: This image is associated with Sunday in the Park with George.

question_text: PICTURE 03: Which show is this production photo / set image from? (Into the Woods)
explanation: This image is from a production of Into the Woods.

question_text: PICTURE 04: Which show is this poster / key art for? (Company)
explanation: This image is associated with Company.

question_text: PICTURE 05: Which show is this production photo / set image from? (Sweeney Todd)
option_d: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: This image is from a production of Sweeney Todd.

question_text: PICTURE 06: Name the performer shown here (as Mrs Lovett).
explanation: Angela Lansbury famously played Mrs Lovett in the original Broadway production.

question_text: PICTURE 07: Which show is this poster / key art for? (Pacific Overtures)
option_d: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
explanation: This image is associated with Pacific Overtures.

question_text: PICTURE 08: Name the performer shown here (as the Witch).
explanation: Bernadette Peters played the Witch in the original Broadway production of Into the Woods.

question_text: PICTURE 09: Which show is this poster / key art for? (Follies)
explanation: This image is associated with Follies.

question_text: PICTURE 10: Name the performer shown here (originating Georges Seurat/George).
explanation: Mandy Patinkin originated the role of Georges Seurat/George in Sunday in the Park with George.
